item.title: Deploy microservices on Kubernetes
item.description: Kubernetes (AKA k8s) has gained widespread adoption in recent years as a platform for microservices due to its ability to seamlessly automate app deployment at scale. Pinterest uses a suite of over 1000 microservices to power their “discovery engine”. Imagine having to configure and manage servers to run these services manually. It’s an Engineer’s nightmare to say the least. Kubernetes bills itself as “a portable, extensible open-source platform for managing containerized workloads and services”.

item.title: How to run multiple apps on one server using Docker and Traefik
item.description: Running multiple apps on a single machine has never been easier! In this tutorial, I’ll show you how to run 3 apps on one server using Docker and Traefik. Use case Say you’re low on cash and can only rent one server, you can run your website, blog and SaaS app on the same machine (what we’ll do in this tutorial). Or you can run an API (back-end) and SPA (front-end).
